review: This poor Chili's is downright tragic, yet stays packed all the time.  The service is horrendous and it's your usual Chili's all over the place fare.  I have rarely been there when this place is clean and the waitstaff was ever attentive.  Sadly it's a good place to take your children for a reasonably priced dinner with selections they would like.

cold, order not correct.  ordered for takeout and order was incomplete and completely cold although picked up within 15 minutes of order.  how do you screw up club sandwich and boneless wings?  yet, they did.
Service was a bit disorganized late on a Thursday night. Santa Fe chicken salad was much better than expected.

This place is a mad house. It's very busy and I get that, but come on now.... Brittany, you suck. The hostess told us it would be 20 minutes without offering the bar area. He only offered after I said something about the three empty tables.  Which by the way, were dirty.  We waited a while before I went to the bar to find out about our server, who turned around and said she would be with us in a minute. Only to have ignored us most of the time, especially after I had a talk with the manager. The  loaded baked potato soup sucks. The chips and salsa were good.  The manager Ally was nice and offered a free dessert. Way to go Ally.  I would not recommend this place.

Bad choice going here, Mediocre food, disorganized service. My wife has bugged me to go here for a long time, she worked in the Food Service industry when she was younger. I don't like Chain restaurants and this place is exactly why. When we pulled up the parking lot was jammed packed, they share the parking lot with a couple other business so its always busy. We didn't wait that long to be seated, our waitress took our order right away, which was great because we were starving. We decided on a sampler appetizer a Maple Bacon cheeseburger and a Monterrey Chicken. Our appetizer came out fairly fast, but you could see why, the portion size was small, but tasty. I had ordered a water and when i got it it had a couple lemons floating, I hate when they put lemon in the water without asking if i wanted lemon aid i would have order it. We were not finished our appetizer when our food arrived. At first glance booth looked great. so we hurried the last of the Potato skins so they could take away. I took a bite of a fry and it tasted like it was dipped in Maple syrup as i checked my plate i seen a pool of syrup, i asked my server did my cheeseburger come with Maple syrup she told me the bacon was cooked in it.  My bun was soaked in the syrup, i didn't want her to make another i seen the Movies where they spit in your food if you complain. Then i notice there wasn't onion rings on it either, i usually don't bitch about my food, but the main reason i ordered that cheeseburger was for the bacon and onion rings since i normally don't get to eat it. My wife's chicken seemed ok but she said her food wasn't that hot, plus she asked for Broccoli but got a ear of corn. Our waitress seemed very busy or at the end of her shift, it was hard to get her so we could get more drinks. By the end of our meal we finally got her and she ended up putting our drinks in to go containers. After we left my wife called the manager to complain, we didn't do it in the restaurant so he could fix the issue. The Manager offered free meal coupons but i didn't want them and after that he didn't seem to care much. So overall our experience kinda sucked and not worth $50, i seriously doubt i will ever eat there again.
This review will be short and sweet. This place sucks. The food is horrible. The end!!!
We have always liked Chili's.  We were there at 4 pm on a Friday and got great service.  The rasberry margarita, sirloin steak, grilled shrimp and twice backed potato were great.
Another big chain restaurant. You aren't going to get much in the way of surprises, either good or bad, by going here.

The only reason I came honestly was because I had a gift card just for chilis. This place is horrible . The servers are ok (depending who you get), the food had no type of season, especially the sirloin steak. You'll have to put some steak sauce to make it have some kind of taste. Everything was just horrible. And the fact that the server didnt come and check on us, it's ridiculous . Also, we only have had our food for 5 minutes and I didn't even finish trying to eat it

Well, now I know why this place has such low reviews. The hostess was less than pleasant and seemed as though she could care less about us.  Our guacamole was bland. Second, the onion strings weren't cooked well and instead of being golden brown, they were almost white.  The mango tilapia tasted as if the fish wasn't cleaned properly and the broccoli had been sitting out for a while.  Luckily we had a great server and she was super helpful. I can only hope she land a job at a restaurant that serves better food.

I also recieved a gift card for Chili's.  It should have been a tip off when I was seated and the HOST kept pulling his pants up as he escorted me to my table. The inside is filthy ( food and utensils on the floor)Food is horrible. Had Carribean grilled chicken salad. Chicken was not grilled , I'm willing to bet that it was microwaved. Greens in salad looked like they should have been thrown the day before. Now I have to figure out who do I dislike enough to give the remaining 14 bucks on my card as a gift. I won't be back !!!!!!

First of all the hostess was nice and looked pleased to assist me with my needs. Five minutes later while talking to her my waiter came and took my order...awesome because i didnt have to wait like normally.  food was kool however i am im love with their dessert...lol...the chocolate skillet cookie is to die for..... Overall my table was clean and i was pleased with my experience

90% of what I think of a restaurant is service. Walked into Chili's on Vets about 6 pm and no one was on duty at the hostess stand. It wasn't at all busy so we went to the bar to be seated. There were several dirty tables and a few bar stool type tables that were available. Usually we don't have to wait very long to get a table bussed so we waited. When the waitress comes out, I asked if she would clean the table so we could sit down. Her reply, " When I find time." Ok, so nasty remark. I go to the bar to sit down and instead of her cleaning the table we were waiting for she passes us and I tell her, "Thanks".  She in turn tells me, "I'll get to cleaning the tables when I find time." And she also tells the bartender so as to eliminated us from ever getting service. No manager on duty, no one to see the attitude the servers have with their guests. We walked out and went to Austins. Boy what a complete difference and so glad we left. BTW we usually tip no less than 20% and sometimes more. Ask the waiter at Austins.

The service was so bad that all we could do was laugh about it.  It took two hours to get a table but we saw people coming in after us and getting seated before us. Of course we asked about it but got the brush off. We were finally seated in the bar area where the one server was clearly overwhelmed. My food finally came and my order was wrong (of course). I will NOT be returning.

Ok the food is great but they have the WORST service! While my hubby and I waited for a host for like 5-10mins. Mind you NO ONE was there but maybe 3-4 couples total. So finally a host. We say down for about 20-30mins! No server! So someone finally come to take our order. We order our drinks and appetizers. 30mins later not a drink and no appetizers! We called the other waitress she said it was coming. Lady came to out table with the WRONG APPETIZERS and NO DRINKS! That was it I told my husband let's go and had to walk out. I like their food but that will be the last time I go to this place.

Chilis use to be one of my favorites... however i cant say ill be back after my last experience. For one they seat all the folks with kids in the same section, my child is well behaved so i don't want to be in a section full of screaming kids. It was very obvious that the whole section was reserved just for those with children.  Strike one chilis They put those cute tablets on the table however no one informs you that your charged to play games on them, granted 99 cents isn't going to break the bank, it still would be nice to be informed which i was not until i saw my bill, also things where pretty dirty in there another thing not use to seeing.  Strike two chilis and last but not least, the chicken tenders with the awesome breading that you cannot get anywhere else are no longer there, however they are still called the original chicken tenders. I'm not a chicken tenders and french fries kind of gal however I have always loved the way Chilis did them, one big reason i would go there. I was more than disappointed that they where changed, but still advertised as the original Strike 3 chilis  you've lost my business for good
While I do like Chili's and the menu. This particular location is horrible. The service is really bad. Do yourselfg a favor and do not fo to this place. I am amazed how this location even stays open?

Came here for lunch with my wife and we did not enjoy our experience. About 15 minutes went by before anybody came to greet us and get our drink order. Took another 5-10 mins to receive the drinks and another 30 mins after that to receive our food. They must be tremendously under-staffed.  The food was decent I had the BBQ smokehouse burger (which I asked for medium-medium rare and it came out extra well done) and my wife had the $8 bacon avocado sandwich special which was a good value. All I can say is thank you for having the table side kiosk to pay for our bill otherwise my wife probably would have been late for work! We will not be going back

I won't return to this location. Service was terrible. My order was messed up, took over 10 minutes to just wipe down the table in the bar area. Food was OK, I know what I get into at these places. Wouldn't recommend until they train their staff better.

I went there last night , the food was very good. The environment was relaxing and clean!! The server was attentive and friendly. I really believe they should put a door to block the kitchen because its pretty nasty in there on a busy shift. Other then that , no complaints

I hate writing reviews like this but thats what Yelp! Is for. My boyfriend and I went to chilis last night at about 10 p.m.. It was a Saturday so the place was pretty packed but there were three seats at the bar so we decided to sit there. Upon walking up to the bar, there was a live roach sitting on the bar. The bartender walked up and we quietly pointed to the roach so she could fix the problem without disturbing the couple that was sitting right next to us eating.  The bartender screamed and said that she doesn't do roaches and acted like she wanted to hand the wet bar towel to my boyfriend to kill it. After a couple of seconds and a few dirty looks she decided to go get someone else to kill the roach. Another girl came in and wiped the roach, who was alive, off of the bar with the wet bar towel and shook it off in the trash. In my opinion she should have thrown away the towel but that's neither here nor there. Trying to be understanding we we're going to stay and eat but sit in a different location . As we were standing there waiting for them to clean us a table, I heard a loud noise from the back and could see under the saloon style kitchen doors that the chip scoop had fallen out of the chips and was laying on the floor. Two people walked past and didn't see it. Another girl walks past and kicks it across the floor. She immediately picked it up and threw it right back into the chip bin. No washing, nothing. It went from being kicked across the floor to back into the chip bin. We immediately got up and left and I asked to see a manager. The manager walked up to me and immediately started to apologize about the roach incident. I then informed her of the chip scoop situation and she honestly looked mortified. She asked me if I could identify the person who did it but I couldn't because I could only see the bottom half of the kitchen under the doors. She explained that she would be throwing the chips away and making new ones and having them wash the scoop. But I didn't stay to confirm it actually happened. This was the worst experience I've ever had at a chilis. We usually eat at the chilis on Manhattan which is much cleaner. We will not be going back to this Chili's on Vets.

Damn.... How do you tell your relatives that you would really like them to NOT give you a Christmas gift if it's a gift card to this godforsaken place?? I know I sound ungrateful but that is how bad this place is... Every year, I get at least 2 gift cards to this shit hole and when I use it once a year, I am constantly reminded just how much I can't stand it!!!! From the minute you walk in the door and see the shitty look on the hostess' face where you stand ungreeted for nearly 15 min to the ridiculously long wait time while the place is filled with empty tables to the unappetizing cafeteria food to the miserable all around service.... Just end my suffering and take me off the Christmas list.. You are throwing your hard earned momey down the drain... Just give me a Starbucks card instead or even just a hug will do!!!

Manager saved the day - there were signs on the door for a bonus gift card with a gift card purchase. To go check out staff were not aware of this and told me there was no bonus. I mentioned it to the folks on the way out and they asked me to wait. Who knew, she was the manager! She came back to get me so I could my bonus gift card.  Great job of service recovery, I'll definitely be back to a place where the manager cares enough to fix issues promptly.

Everytime my husband and I choose to eat here, we wait at the hostess stand for at least 10 minutes.  I noticed we will wait to be seated even when they are not very busy, so it may be a temporary short staffing issue.  Lately, we have been calling our food in and picking it up in the To-Go Orders Counter.  They have really improved their to-go food service in the past months.  My husband and I take advantage of the two entrées and an appetizer deal for $20.00 about once a week.  We always order the ribs which are the best thing on the menu I think.  They have a honey chipotle sauce that is sweet and spicy.  For our appitizer, we order the southwest eggrolls.  You have to ask for this appetizer when getting the 2 for $20.00 deal because it is not listed on the menu.  The wait time on to-go orders is usually 30 minutes if they are very busy so I suggest calling your order in first then going to pick it up.   This way you can get an accurate wait time from the waiter/waitress taking your order.  I always tip 20% on to-go orders. They are good at double checking your food to make sure its all there before you leave.  If you do not feel like cooking dinner during the week, I suggest trying their to-go service.  The food prices are reasonable and the food is always still warm when I get home.

First and last time at this establishment. I would give it zero starts if I could.  My mother, baby and I went to Chili's for lunch during my lunch-break. The moment you walk into the restaurant it smells like a dirty dish rag. The place is freezing cold and uninviting. We are placed at the back of the restaurant, which is empty and cold. The waitress took 15 minutes to come to our table. We ordered immediately and the food took about 45 mins to an hour to come during lunch - ridiculous!! My mother's coffee took 30 minutes to come. The waitress kept saying everything would be ready in a few "moments" - I think she needs a dictionary. We complained about how long the food was taking and were offered a salad while we waited. It never came. The food arrives after about an hour and it is not even hot. The salad that came with my food was soggy and wilted. Then comes the bill. The "extra" salad we were supposed to be getting because our food was taking so long was actually on the bill!!!! It had been comped because it never came, but why was it even on the bill? Would we have been charged for it if it had actually been served? And to top it off the food was gross. This was the absolute worst dining experience!!!!! Do not come here!! You have been warned!!!!

Why 4 stars? The server and the manager bent over backwards to make sure I was happy when only one of the apps came out bad. I ordered the bottomless chips and salsa, the queso, and the onion rings.  I intended to also get the chicken fajitas but the queso ruined the experience for me.  The chips and salsa and the onion rings were solid.  Not the best I've ever had but good enough to order again if I came back.  The queso however came out sizzling on a skillet and got burnt for it. The server told me that it wasn't normal to come out like that, but they were concerned it was going out cold.  I couldn't eat it and didn't want a replacement, but the server got me one anyways.  They comped it from the bill and were very nice and felt sincere.   I would go back again, but I would not get the queso.

The people are very friendly & courteous & make you feel at home. So far, every thing that I have ordered to eat was delicious. They're Enchilada Soup & Potato Soup is to die for! The managers usually walk around to make sure everything is ok. I will be back!

Never coming here again unless I have gift cards (and reluctantly even then).  I actually had gift cards for this trip too, luckily.  My SO and I split a few items: spinach queso dip, salsa, chicken/steak fajitas, smokehouse burger with fries, and a blueberry-pineapple margarita.  The margarita was the best think we got. The "spinach" queso dip was just queso with three spinach leaves in it.  And the spinach gave it kind of an odd taste. The salsa was not good.  To me at least.  Just tasted artificial. The fajitas were AWFUL.  The sliced steak pieces were incredibly dry and tough, the chicken tasted processed, and there was absolutely no flavor to the dish.  Terrible.   The burger and fries were actually good, however.  The fries were well cooked and seasoned.  It seemed like the portion of fries was a bit small, but whatever.  And I ordered my burger medium rare, but it came medium/medium well.  Disappointing, but at least it tasted ok. And the margarita was exactly as described, and pretty good. Finally, the service.  Our food took FOR-EV-ER.  And my burger came out a full 10 minutes before her fajitas - WTH??  And after the waitress brought the burger, she came back and even asked what my SO had ordered.  So I don't know what the heck was going on. Ugh.  Avoiding this place at all costs from now on...

CAME Here Due TO The Boil Water Advisory IN Orleans PARISH 07/25/15 Worst Food Ever  SouthWest EggRolls Taste Like A Dirty Mop Had To Keep Bugging PASSING Waiters For Things My Waitress Divide Provide WILL NOT RETURN

I didn't have a enough space in my video comment to tell you'll how tough this fuck burnt up as steak. A waste of my goddam money and time. You'll have to do better, I couldn't even enjoy my meal. Yall get no stars from me shit I should be reimbursed for having to eat it crap. I would feed this to a stray dog

So far.. NOT IMPRESSED!   The hostess just gives up that glaring stare without saying a word.  Me being me ... She got a bubbly Hello ! Table for three.  Sticky dirty table. Waitress took a while to take our drink order.  I ordered an appetizer and when it arrived they actually asked if I needed a plate.   Well yeah !! Even though it was only the southern west egg rolls. Waiting on my food .... I'm sure more to come.

Yeah, I'm a Yelper who likes Chili's, judge away. There's something comforting about eating the same food from the same high powered microwaves for the past decade that keeps me coming back. That, and the skillet queso. Duh. So I guess what I really am reviewing here is the consistency, and there is not much to be said for that here. I've ordered to-go from here a handful of times, and it's always been mediocre at best, and sometimes disappointing. The wings are always too greasy or taste of old grease, and it seem like working the to-go computer is an MIT grad school endeavor on each visit. That being said, the skillet queso is there, an it's always amazing.

Ok let me start by saying the bartenders here are awesome! It's not their fault the restraint is horrible. I went in for dinner tonight and the drinks were awesome and the food was good. Nasty men's bathroom that I fell in while wearing a nice suit. Avoid this place! This is my second time coming here with a nasty environment.

There were 4 adults and 1  two year old and we waited one hour for our food. We got no answers why and when the food came it was wrong. We finally got the manager and he was not with it either. His answer was to give us one free ice tea off our bill in spite of our food being cold when they finally figured it out. Poor service.

I'm one of those people that comes to Chili's and orders the same thing everytime. Today was no different; the honey Chipotle chicken crispers were the  . We came during happy hour to also get our hands on the 2 for 1 house margaritas deal; they are always really good...you know, the kind that sneaks up on you! Lol. Very nice taste, smooth, and frozen is how I like 'em. The strawberry lemonade is usually pretty good, but I suppose we received a bad batch; it tasted like water from the tap, metals and all. The server seemed to be preoccupied everytime he came to our table and we had to stop him several times to ask for ketchup and A1 sauce, but overall he was nice. After the meal, we paid straight from the table on a portable kiosk...No more waiting for receipts here! That was extremely convenient.  Overall, a good visit and we will be back.

How do you delete the 1 star? That's 3 stars too many. First off request "rocky" is not your waitress, lots of little reasons why, no plates with apps. Had to ask several times for refills,napkins, overall unpleasant attitude. Food came out at room temp. When I said take it back and just remove the charge ( I've worked as a server, never send back food and expect it to come back clean) she didn't even ask why, hell she didn't even say a word just took the plate and walked away. Outback steakhouse isn't far from here, go there instead. If 1 thing was off I wouldn't complain but for ducks sake not 1 thing was right not 1. We seriously should only be paying for drinks. Ohhh and this just happened, she asked if it was together or separate at the beginning. All 3 of us were clear in saying separate, guess what? I've had better attitudes from dicks last resort. ( you know... the place that has fun being jerks.) seriously how do I remove stars?

We arrived an hour before closing time. Minutes went by before we were seated; we didn't get a server until 10 minutes after seating. There is barely anyone here so there's no reason for a hold up. After ordering steak fajitas and chicken quesadillas, our server disappeared- no refills on cold drinks, or checking in. She arrived 15 minutes later with the tortillas and the toppings for the fajitas; however, the actual steak and pepper dish had not finished cooking. By the time the steak and peppers came, the tortillas were cold. The quesadillas were so lukewarm they felt like leftovers. Ever since the pay machines have been personalized to the table, I suppose waiters are harder to come by for simple tasks. Two stars ONLY-ONLY because of the food and drink options.
Always a fav of my Babygirl.  Busy, yet quick seating service for early dinner.  Most importantly, hard to beat the 2/20 deals.  Let's eat!

A few minutes after being sat at our table, our server came and got our drink order. After a couple of minutes, we got our drinks and decided we wanted soup. I wanted the southwest chicken. She said she never had anyone order that before and she didnt even know it existed. She asked me if i wanted something else and i said no. About 10 minutes later, she brought the soup out with no garnish whatsoever and said she didnt even know they had this. Very disconcerting that an employee has no idea what is on the menu... We ordered salads. Quesadilla explosion...  after ordering, we were informed that they did not have the dressing that goes on this salad. So, we got different dressings. We asked the server what kind of vinaigrettes were available and she did not know. Eventually, we ordered honey lime and just a regular vinaigrette. When the salads were delivered, we got an oil and vinegar. I guess that is supposed ro be the regular vinaigrette. Well, there was about 1/2 ounce of vinegar in an extremely dirty bottle that had a hair stuck on the pour spout. GROSS! Then, we waited about 7 minutes to be checked on. We showed her the bottle and she said, "That's gross". Well, you brought it out. You didnt see that it was empty and dirty??? Gi somewhere else, you all. This is definitely not a good place to eat...

I love the food from this restaurant in general BUT the service is not that good and today, after 10min. Of waiting to be seated (the restaurant was not full) I had to leave. There where about 6 tables with food still on it, fries and dirt ALL OVER the restaurant. Went to the bathroom, you can see the kitchen from the hallway n the floor looked dirty n wet. Once I return from the bathroom we had to leave, it's only 3:15, there's no way the restaurant should be that dirty during the week n before dinner.
Nothing at all to write home about.......the service was terribly slow. The food was horrible....... management is poor. This will be my last time coming here.

The service here sucks the sweat off a dead rhinos balls. Sat at a booth for 15 minutes, waitress walked passed our table a dozen times and couldn't be bothered to acknowledge we were there. Got up and walked out. Fuck you Chilis.

Chili's lost another star today. Every Time I come here I keep saying I don't want to come back. I find myself popping in again hoping it won't be as bad as the last time.   Today while having an outing with my mom and two children this was the closest place to eat. I was happy to see it wasn't super busy. Apparently that doesn't help the service. We were there for almost 2 hours. We ordered chips and salsa because I figured the food would take a while and I had two hungry children. Surely chips and salsa will come out quick. Nope! I had to get a manager to go get them for us. Then I had to go walk to the bar to get us bar napkins because we weren't brought napkins or silverware and all the workers disappeared. 3 out of 4 entrees came out a while later. I got the honor of watching everyone eat while my food was nowhere to be found. I did get it some time later. No one was apologetic or accommodating. Of course I had to wait a while for a take out box. Then when the bill came I had a charge for that little game thingy they have on the table. The kids didn't even play on it. They were coloring! Seriously! This is only a short list of how bad it was today. I can not justify giving them my money anymore!

Hats off to our server Meika who was outstanding!!! Ask for her!!!!! Attentive, happy, did a great job.  We started with drinks and apps.  2for1 specials all day means smaller portions and they bring both to the table at the same time. Onion rings were not plated well, with a few scattered on a large plate. Guac said table side which really means premade guac with a few pieces of avocado on top mixed with other premade precooked ingredients at your table. Not worth the effort and not in the same ballpark with Abuelos version. Salsa was runnier than I remember...  Southwestern egg rolls were delicious and saving grace for appetizers.   Fajitas were a let down. All ingredients precooked then placed on really hot pan to give smokey appearance when serving. Tacos would have been better option with carnitas having good flavor, shrimp crazy spicy, and great prime rib. Enchiladas  are also a good choice.

When we first arrived there was not a host or hostess at the front to greet or serve customers. When we were seated the appetizer showed up late and then there was a huge gap of time until the food arrived (30 mins). Once the food arrived there was two plates missing. I would recommend to hire a better manager and overall customer service

Today, for the first time, I had someone incapable of taking a phone order.  I don't know if this is their first job, but they: A) didn't know the menu, B) couldn't put the order in, and C) couldn't get the order name right. I finally gave up after 5 mins and got food from elsewhere. I would've gone online to order, but their online menu is incomplete.  And whenever I've ordered in person, it always takes forever and they don't have half the items I'm looking for.  (They ran out of avocados to make guacamole one time. :-/)

Terrible service! We have had bad service here in the past but we decided to give it a try again, and that was a big mistake! We were seated at our table for 30 minutes and we still hadn't received our chips and salsa. Our waitress got 3 out of our 4 drinks wrong and she didn't write our food order down so we had to repeat it and then she came back to our table 10 minutes later to ask what we ordered. We just got up and left. Such a shame because we grew up in this area and loved this Chili's back in the day. We will never go back!
The food suckssss The queso was like eating a salt lick .Ewww.The chips again salt overload! .Service was good tho.

The server was excellent, however the food was not. It was a mother daughter date; My mother ordered a fajita trio which was good but was all scorched black in the pan and I ordered the smokehouse burger which was drenched in grease and barbecue sauce. The southwest egg rolls we ordered as an appetizer were delicious.. but was disappointed because the once complimentary chips and salsa you now have to pay for. Needless to say we will not be returning anymore.  Btw we also got a steak dinner to go for my Father and the mashed potatoes that came with it looks like paste.

Just walked out of this hell hole ... Half empty.. Had to wait 25 minutes for a table that was 8 feet away and clean the entire time.  The bathroom floors had urine all over the place. Once we finally got seated, no wait staff ever made themselves present. We waited 10 minutes seated; complete waste of time. Just got up and left. Went to bonefish grill and got treated like royalty.
Service is atrocious don't try to call food in they never pick up the phone long lines and servers just don't seem to care

I ordered the Sunrise burger and the egg was not how it was supposed to be. We sat in the back towards the kitchen and the staff was extremely loud. We were surprised the manager or nobody in charge didn't tell them anything about it. Never going there again.

This place , boy boy , we had came about a week before and it wasn't this horrible but it still wasn't the best . Like what it balls down to I think is management , who ever the manager is corporate needs to check em lol . So we went I think it was Sunday and it was like 630 so we get in and there is a wait , well there were tables empty and also tables which the waitstaff had customers in before bc it was obvious bc the tables were sitting their unbused, and no one came to do so until the waiter did it themselves for their own section but even after that it sat their and then like after waiting for what was the time she told us it was gonna be which was 45 mins we got seated the waitress was very nice but very hard to get when we needed her like for an example our drinks were bad so we needed to get new ones I swear we sat their 15 mins waiting for her to come around and to tell her then it took a little to get the drinks what we figured was that they needed more workers and they were working the waiters on too many tables but what got us was the manager was walking around not helping not busting ass to help , smh , I'm over chilis it's become like our last resort which is sad bc I don't mind their food which isn't too bad don't get the fried pickles their nasty as all hell and I find their burgers have gotten so small but the chips and salsa was good , but the chips last time we did go wasn't cooked all the way and very greasy . We prob won't bc back unless someone gives us a gift card again lol

Had the Classic Bacon Burger with fries wasn't all that good. Fries were kinda tough had to wait for mustard after asking 2 times when I was almost done eating. My gf had the ribs and fries was ok, but to top all this off a roach came crawling off the menu trying to get to our food before we could start eating. Manager came over to see if we was ok well no we not a roach is on the table spoiled my appetite. I must say though drinks were on point and she did take care of the bill. I really never had no problems visiting this particular location but there ok though.

The only thing that made this experience better was the NEW kitchen manager John. A party of We got there around 8:00, was seated at 8:20 and didn't receive our food until 9:10. There was a couple seated 30 mins after us who received there food very fast. John explained the situation with the store changing management and how they are trying to change the restaurant the food tasted good but was slightly cold. I wouldn't say it was so horrible I would never go there again BUT I don't think I'll be back for a while

After many chances and making excuses for this place, like "well it's to-go so it's just not going to be that good", I'm done. Ate at Chilis in Hammond 3 times in the past month, while working up there, and ordered the same thing (smothered smoked chicken burrito).  It was excellent.  Ordered the same thing at this store it was a dried out mess! Nothing like the others!  It was rolled with terrible with no sauce and had been sitting under the heat lamps for way to long!  I normally wouldn't give a one star review for this food alone, but after many times of being very unsatisfied, and seeing other locations provide 5 star quality, it is deserved!

Short of staff , when you come in ur looking crazy waiting to be seated . If you don't know what you want already your wait time will be longer!  The food was average not we had to chase the waiter down for drinks ! Than wait even more for the bill !  Seeing that it was a late lunch it was empty on arrival but I'm guessing they gave the young man too many tables

The server we had was horrible! My son and I waited more than 30 minutes for the appetizer. I ordered us the Texas cheese fries and it was overly cooked. We still ate it due to us being so hungry. Our entrée was okay (served hot but no taste). Overall, I won't be coming here unless I'm really desperate.

Ordered 6 oz steak.  Received what looked like approximately a 3 oz steak  Drinking glass had scum on the inside of it, which you could scratch off with your finger nail.  Gross!  Worse part about it is that I did not notice it at first and drank out of the glass.

This was my first visit in several years. I only came because I had a gift card. Even though the meal was free, it wasn't worth the visit. We were seated right away but waited at least ten minutes before a server came over. Then we waited another ten minutes for our drinks (waters ...). Everything was very slow. The quality of food has declined over the years. The only thing that was tasty at all was the classic chips and salsa.  I order the crispy chicken tenders. Something was off about the texture. The chicken tasted rubbery and just not the right way when you bite into it. I could have eaten better chicken nuggets at Wendy's. And the fries tasted dry, as if they had been sitting out for at least an hour. My dining partner ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich. The texture of his was also odd. It almost didn't taste like real chicken. Seems like Chili's quality has definitely declined. And the service was terribly slow. As we were leaving, there was a spill at the front door covered in paper towels with an employee standing nearby. Just terrible.

Very upset with not only the food but also the service tonight at chilis. We arrived not long after six and barely left at almost eight. Our server was super slow and I think overwhelmed not sure if she knows how to time manage.  After 45 our solitudes arrived and then 20 min after we finished that our entrees arrived. My chicken was undercooked, rubbery with odd flavored sauce that I have gotten multiple times before being consistent but not today and corn overcooked. Yes I thought about telling her but by the time she came back my son was fussy and ready to leave, mind you it was about 10/15 more minutes still she showed up again. Kids can only last so long in a restaurant at his age (2) without getting fussy. We always come here and I always get the same chicken crispers and never have a problem, plus order dessert! But tonight it was terrible... I don't plan on returning here and I do not recommend you to either.

Went here for a late night drink. Bartender made us feel like we were bothering her and when we still had drinks even though they were ready to close down they started flipping the chairs to make us feel like we needed to leave. The manager even said it was rude that I was still there 10 minutes after they closed. Won't be back here even though the egg rolls and chicken tenders are delicious.
Me and my wife love to come here the service is always great and the food is always good and consistent

The WORSSSSEEEE Chili's I've ever been to! Absolutely unbelievable. Good was terrible and the service was just as worse.  They don't deserve the 1 star, but I had to select something in order for it to post.

Made the mistake of giving this place another chance, and it was still pretty bad. $3 ice teas (ridiculous!) and $6.50 for an appetizer of 8 onion rings?! My ribs were dry and the french fries, the few there were on the plate, were stale.. My companion had the sirloin with avocado salad and she liked it. Other person had the Caribbean chicken salad and thought it was OK too. Still overall I did not enjoy the meal and for $58 plus tip for lunch there are much better places you can eat.

Pretty on par with any Chili's I've been to, however, our waiter in particular could have been more attentive. She would take our order and drop the food off never coming back to our table again. This location is clean and the food was good, although I wouldn't recommend the new chicken crispers and waffles. The waffles are so sweet it's literally sickening.

I was here yesterday around 3:30 with my son who is 12. We enjoyed ourselves and the food. There was no wait as there weren't too many people in the place. I ordered the chicken quesadilla off the lunch menu and my son ordered the new Big Texas ribs. They were right, they do have more meat!  He got some fries and I love potatoes so I messed around and ordered loaded mashed potatoes. Well my son didn't complain. He ate all of his ribs and had BBQ sauce all over his face because he obviously wasn't playing. He didn't touch the fries, I tried them and I think they had been sitting too long. I discovered my loaded potatoes were powder so after picking at the toppings I left them alone. My son also ordered a mini molten lava cake for $2.49. We thought it was going to be an itty bitty thing and boy were we surprised to see it was pretty large. I wonder what the regular one looks like. It must really be big. Well I helped him eat it and it was tasty. Had I known it was going to be so large, I would have ordered my own since I greedy.  Our waitress was friendly, and efficient.  She checked on us and got whatever we asked for with promptly.  I come here sometimes during the week for lunch and the last time I was here a month or so ago, I ordered the quesadilla. I was very pleased with it then and was just as pleased yesterday to find out it was just as good. I love when I go someplace and get something that I like and can come back and find it is still just as good. That is rare, but Chili's seems to have the knack for that.   I plan to return soon but I think I might try something else on the menu because so many things look good.

I hadn't been to chili's in years! So why not, right?  Well we got there around 2:30 P.M. after the lunch rush. The restaurant was still pretty full but there were empty tables. We were asked to wait 5-10 minutes so they could clean the tables off. No problem! We actually sat down at our table ten minutes later. I was pleased.  We didn't have to wait long for our server. She greeted us right away and got our drink order. She was nice and helpful.  The restaurant floors were dirty because of the lunch rush, but the staff actually started to clean the floors!  This has not been the case in the past per my experience.  Our appetizer was delicious! It was chicken crispers and waffles. It was part spicy and sweet. I highly recommend getting this dish! Wow!! My cheese burger was cooked medium. It was actually cooked correctly. It was tasty too!  The fries were hot and fresh.  I was definitely pleased! Keep up the good job.

coming on a saturday night my family and i already know it's going to be busy. i work in a restaurant, i know how saturday's go! it would be 30-45 minutes to be seated- so we wait. an hour and a half later (why we didn't just leave is beyond me) we are finally seated. we are greeted by our waitress who takes our very lengthy order with no pad... look you don't impress me by not writing down our order, it actually makes me nervous.  WRITE IT DOWN!!! SPECIALLY ON A SATURDAY!! we order three alcoholic drinks- the triple appetizer thing- two salmons and a hamburger. we knew the wait for food was going to be long but our waitress didn't even come check on us. finally the manager came to see how we were doing. when we talked about the drinks he came minutes later with them in hand. woo!!! something in our bellies.  45 minutes later- no appetizers. 10 minutes later she comes out with our food. lady, where the H E L are our appetizers? of course she forgot to put it in! THATS WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU DONT WRITE THE ORDER DOWN! anyway we finish our food in seconds (cause we were starving). and had to wait 20 minutes for the check. and another 10 minutes for her to pick it up. wow, i always give waiters the benefit of the doubt but this was next level horrible service. she checked on us 2 times while we were there for an hour and a half. [[IMPORTANT]]. JUST. WRITE. DOWN. THE. ORDER. i would leave her $0 if i could. but my dad was feeling nice and gave an $11 of a $70 check.
